decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

The proposed development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the materials detailed under Section 8 of the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To ensure that the appearance of the proposed development will harmonise with the character of the surrounding area.
The car parking spaces shown on 'Drawing 5 of 5 (Revision B)' shall be implemented and permanently retained for the parking of private motor vehicles only and not for any other purpose.
To provide satisfactory off-street parking at the site.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the applicant via email on 22/12/21 and 17/01/22. The revisions involved an amendment to the design of the proposed gate and its mechanism (changing it from one which opened and closed to a sliding one) respectively. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 22/12/21 and 24/01/22 respectively.
description: Replacement of Garage Door, removal and renovation of the existing paving of the driveway. Erection of front boundary wall and gate.
